algorithms

Class AbstractSchedulingAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.AbstractSchedulingAlgorithm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SchedulingAlgorithm
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NonPreemptiveAlgorithm

    public abstract class AbstractSchedulingAlgorithm
extends java.lang.Object
implements SchedulingAlgorithm
    Superclass of scheduling algorithms. This class ensures that subclasses do not have to worry about formatting the Gantt Chart to be displayed.
    See Also:
    GanttChartFactory

      • processJobs

        public AlgorithmResult processJobs(Job[] jobset)
        Processes a set of jobs. This method provides its own copy of the jobs, therefore it is safe to reuse the Job array passed into this method to another Scheduling Algorithm.
        Specified by:
        processJobs in interface SchedulingAlgorithm
        Parameters:
        jobset - The array of jobs
        Returns:
        The algorithm result

      • first

        protected Job first()
        Since it's annoying when changing containers.
        Returns:
        the next incoming job in the queue

      • makeGanttChart

        public final GanttChart makeGanttChart()
        Returns the resulting Gantt Chart. This method returns a new DefaultGanttChart every time it is called, more specifically, a clone of the internal chart. This means that the chart returned is perfectly independent of this class, and from the other charts returned by this method.
        Specified by:
        makeGanttChart in interface SchedulingAlgorithm
        Returns:
        The Gantt Chart
        See Also:
        processJobs()

        Returns:
